page.title: 05VISIT TO A STOKE DOYLE FARM
page.content: We set off straight away after assembly at 9.30 a.m.,all thirty of us and Mr.Williams to walk along the narrow country road to Stoke Doyle. We got there at 10.25, just in time to visit the farm which was called Seven Wells. We met the farmer who was called Mr.Knight with his dog called Toby. To show us around his farm he took us on his trailer on which we sat on bales of hay. He took us past the fields up the track, past the sugar-beet field and the sheep-dip and past the manure pile until we came to his biggest field which had three different crops in it. From there we could look all over the farm and do the work on land-use in four squares on the map by just looking from this one place! Then we saw the dog catch a rabbit he found in a small copse of trees recently planted by Mr.Knight.
